alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a dialkylamine group, characterized by two alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl fluorides

class.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
class.name: Organonitrogen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 1,2-aminoalcohols. These are organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.
direct_parent.name: 1,2-aminoalcohols

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds that carry a hydroxy and an amino functional groups on an alkane backbone.
intermediate_nodes.name: Alkanolamines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds formally derived from ammonia by replacing one, two or three hydrogen atoms by hydrocarbyl groups, and having the general structures RNH2 (primary amines), R2NH (secondary amines), R3N (tertiary amines).
subclass.name: Amines

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
superclass.name: Organic nitrogen compounds
